meta.subtitle: The Three Makers of Aaron's Holy Vestments

blocks.text: וְעָשִׂיתָ בִגְדֵי קֹדֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹן אָחִיךָ לְכָבוֹד וּלְתִפְאָרֶת

blocks.label: Ein Sof
blocks.tagline: The source of all revelation—אנכי מי שאנכי ('I am Who I am'). This level is לאו מכל מדות איהו כלל—not of any attributes whatsoever.

details.title: Beyond Comprehension
details.content: Even חכמה (Wisdom) is infinitely removed from Ein Sof. As it says: והחכמה מאין תמצא—'Wisdom is found from Nothingness' (Job 28:12). The emergence is יש מאין—existence from absolute nothing.

details.title: No Comparison Possible
details.content: The Tikkunei Zohar states: לאו דאית לך צדק ידיעא... ולא מכל מדות—'He has no known righteousness, nor any of these attributes.' There is no comparison between finite and infinite.

details.title: All Equals Nothing
details.content: As the verse says: כולם בחכמה עשית—'All You made with wisdom.' Before Ein Sof, even supernal Chochmah is like physical making—spirituality and physicality are equal before the Infinite.

blocks.label: Zakan Aharon
blocks.english: The Beard of Aaron · Abundant Kindness
blocks.tagline: The צמצומים (contractions) through which Ein Sof descends to illuminate Chochmah and Chesed. Like hair emerging through tiny skull openings—the vitality is vastly diminished.

details.title: The Hair Metaphor
details.content: Hair emerges from the brain through tiny openings. If you cut your hair, you feel no pain—showing that only the faintest illumination passes through. Similarly, for Ein Sof to illuminate Chochmah requires immense contraction.

details.title: The Teacher-Student Analogy
details.content: Like a teacher using words to convey wisdom to a student—the words aren't the wisdom itself, but vessels for it. The student cannot grasp the teacher's wisdom directly; it must be 'clothed' in letters and speech.

details.title: What Causes This Contraction?
details.content: Our אתערותא דלתתא (arousal from below)! כמים הפנים לפנים—'As water reflects a face.' Our love causes G-d to 'push aside' His transcendence and descend to us. אהבה דוחקת את הבשר—love pushes aside the flesh.

blocks.label: Ahavah Rabbah
blocks.english: Great Love · Aaron the High Priest
blocks.tagline: אהרן has the same letters as נראה (seen)! This love is like seeing the Divine—direct, sensory-like perception. עין בעין נראה—'Eye to eye they shall see.'

details.title: The Seven Shepherds
details.content: Aaron is one of the שבעה רועים (Seven Shepherds) who nourish all Jewish souls. As Kohen Gadol, he draws down אהבה רבה—a love that transcends ordinary experience.

details.title: Kindling the Flame
details.content: Just as Aaron physically kindled the Menorah until the flames rose מאליה (on their own), spiritually he ignites the flame of love in every Jewish heart—bringing hidden love from concealment into revelation.

details.title: Gazing at the King's Glory
details.content: The Zohar's לאסתכלא ביקרא דמלכא—gazing at the King's glory. Deep contemplation until all faculties are nullified in that vision. There's tremendous pleasure in this 'gazing'—an inner, essential delight.

details.title: Elevating Beyond Soul-Root
details.content: Aaron is שושבינא דמטרוניתא—the Matron's attendant. He elevates Jewish souls על צבאותם—above their hosts, beyond their natural soul-root, to Ahavah Rabbah.

blocks.label: Chesed Olam
blocks.tagline: The אתערותא דלעילא that precedes our effort—awakening us from spiritual slumber. This operates within Seder Hishtalshelut, through עילה ועלול (cause and effect).

details.title: The First Awakening
details.content: Even before our arousal from below, there must be an awakening from Above to rouse us. Human nature pulls toward worldly pleasures—we need divine help just to begin.

details.title: Within the Chain of Worlds
details.content: Scripture testifies: וחסד ה' מעולם ועד עולם—'Hashem's kindness is from world to world.' The word עולם indicates this Chesed operates within worldly boundaries.

details.title: Awakening Hidden Love
details.content: This awakening reveals the אהבה מסותרת—the hidden natural love in every Jew. Like a child's love for their parent—not born of contemplation, but natural, as the soul is 'a part of G-d Above.'

blocks.text: The Garments · Torah & Mitzvot as Vessels

blocks.label: Torah — Chochmah
blocks.tagline: Torah draws Ein Sof into חכמה. This is the first drawing-down—ראשית חכמה, the beginning of Hishtalshelut from אין to יש.

details.title: V'hayu HaDevarim Ha'eileh
details.content: אנכי refers to Ein Sof itself. מצוך is from צוותא—connection. The verse means: The revelation of אנכי occurs specifically through 'these words'—the words of Torah!

details.title: Not in Idle Matters
details.content: ודברת בם ולא בדברים בטלים—speak in Torah, not in idle matters. Secular wisdom is 'idle' before G-d: לאו אורחא דמלכא לאשתעי במילי דהדיוטא—it is not the King's way to speak in common matters.

details.title: Torah Lishmah
details.content: Learning Torah לשמה means 'for the sake of the Torah': to draw Ein Sof into Chochmah. Those on Moses' level are חתן (bridegroom) to Torah's כלה (bride)—they give to Torah.

blocks.label: Mitzvot — Chesed
blocks.english: The World Is Built Through Kindness
blocks.tagline: Mitzvot draw Ein Sof into the מדות—especially חסד, which is ראשית הבנין (the beginning of building). The 248 positive mitzvot are רמ"ח אברין דמלכא—248 limbs of the King.

details.title: Mitzvot Are Called Tzedakah
details.content: וצדקה תהיה לנו כי נשמור לעשות—'It will be righteousness for us when we observe to do.' Through mitzvot, we draw Ein Sof into Chesed, building the worlds.

details.title: Derech Hashem
details.content: ושמרו דרך ה' לעשות צדקה—'Keep the way of Hashem to do righteousness.' דרך means 'path'—like a road between cities. Mitzvot create the pathway for divine descent.

details.title: Your Builders
details.content: אל תקרי בניך אלא בוניך—'Don't read "your children" but "your builders."' Israel builds the world through mitzvot. Knesset Yisrael is called תמתי—'my perfect one'—we complete G-d.

blocks.text: The Three Makers of Aaron's Garments

items.description: Souls above Hishtalshelut. Torah lishmah—drawing Ein Sof into Torah.
items.detail:
Source: כי מן המים משיתיהו—'drawn from the water.' His soul was drawn from the hiddenness above Hishtalshelut—the source of Torah in Ein Sof.

Their Role: They are חתן (bridegroom) to Torah's כלה. The 24 books are a כד (pitcher) drawing from the infinite sea.

items.description: Souls of Atzilut. Complete bitul—one heart for G-d alone.
items.detail:
Why 'Wise-Hearted'? Their hearts are entirely in Chochmah—complete nullification. One with two hearts is called נפרד (separated).

Their Garment: לקדשו—'to sanctify him.' Through their bitul, they become a מרכבה (chariot) for the level of Chochmah.

items.description: Souls of BY"A. Kabbalat ol—faithful observance without special inspiration.
items.detail:
Simple Yet Powerful: Just לכהנו לי—'to serve Me'—without 'to sanctify.' Simple mitzvah performance through קבלת עול מלכות שמים.

Na'utz Sofan: נעוץ סופן בתחילתן—the end is rooted in the beginning. Even 'simple' service reaches the highest places!

blocks.title: The Path to Ahavah Rabbah
blocks.intro: How do we awaken this great love? Through contemplation of ה' אחד and wholehearted devotion.

items.content: The Shema precedes ואהבת for good reason. Through hearing and contemplating ה' אחד—G-d's absolute unity—we naturally come to love. The ח (8) = 7 heavens + earth; ד (4) = 4 directions. G-d is א (One) in all.

Even the supernal Sefirot—Chesed and Gevurah of Atzilut—are nullified before Him. Why? כי נשגב שמו לבדו—'His Name alone is exalted.' All worlds derive merely from His הוד (splendor)—a mere external radiance.
With both your inclinations! Even the Yetzer HaRa must be subdued. One whose heart is divided cannot receive Ahavah Rabbah. ועמך לא חפצתי בארץ—'I desire nothing in earth besides You.'
When we 'contract' ourselves—casting aside ego and bodily desires—then 'as water reflects a face,' the supernal love descends. Our contraction draws G-d's contraction.

Through the above, we ascend to בכל מאודך—with all your 'very.' Ahavah Rabbah that transcends the soul's natural capacity, reaching כלות הנפש (expiry of the soul) and ביטול במציאות (nullification of existence).

blocks.content: The blessing before mitzvot is like ברכת חתנים—a wedding blessing! The Zohar teaches: לית ברכתא שריא אלא באתר דדכר ונוקבא—'Blessing only rests where there is male and female.' When light (Ahavah Rabbah) unites with vessel (the mitzvah), blessing flows from above both.

items.content: From מבריך—'to cause to descend,' like bending a vine into the ground. We draw down from the highest source—Moses' level, above Hishtalshelut.
אשר means 'because' (as Rashi explains). Why can such exalted blessing descend? Because You sanctified us through Your mitzvot—because there's a union of light and vessel.
The end goal: revelation of divine sovereignty. מלכותך מלכות כל עולמים—G-d's sovereignty recognized in all realms. Malchut is the ultimate garment enabling infinite to dwell in finite.

rows.avraham: Before our service, to awaken us
The natural, hidden love in every Jew
rows.aharon: Transcendent love beyond the soul's capacity

blocks.content: Aaron's garments are the spiritual 'clothing' that enables infinite love to illuminate finite souls. Every Jew contributes to 'making' these garments—whether through Moses-level Torah study, through the complete bitul of the wise-hearted, or through the faithful kabbalat ol of ordinary Jews. The three 'makings' aren't competing approaches but complementary layers. Our 'contraction' draws G-d's 'contraction': when we nullify our ego and desires, we create space for the Infinite to enter the finite.
